page.title: 07ST.MARY'S CHURCH-T.RUSHTON
page.content: TARRANT RUSHTON CHURCH IS OVER 800 YEARS OLD.THE OLDEST PARTS WERE BUILT IN 1150 .IF YOU LOOK DOWN ON THE CHURCH IT IS IN THE SHAPE OF A GREEK CROSS WHICH MEANS THAT ALL THE ARMS OF THE CROSS ARE THE SAME LENGTH .IN THE PORCH OF THE CHURCH THERE IS A STOUP, WHICH IS A LITTLE STONE BOWL CARVED OUT OF THE WALL AND WHEN PEOPLE COME THEY DIP THEIR FINGERS IN AND MAKE THE SIGN OF THE CROSS ON THEIR FOREHEAD .ABOVE THE DOORWAY THERE IS A CARVING. IT IS ON THE INSIDE BUT IT IS MEANT TO BE ON THE OUTSIDE . THE CARVING IS OF A LAMB . ALSO OVER THE DOORWAY IS AN OLD ALTAR STONE .INSIDE THE CHURCH THERE ARE THREE SQUINTS. THEIR PROPER NAME IS A HAGIOSCOPE WHICH MEANS A HOLY SIGHT.THEY ARE FOR THE PRIESTS TO LOOK THROUGH AND SEE THE ALTAR IF MORE THAN ONE SERVICE IS HAPPENING AT THE SAME TIME.
